definitions.text: be around, often idly or without specific purpose
examples: The object sat in the corner
We sat around chatting for another hour
When does the court of law sit?

definitions.text: assume a posture as for artistic purposes
examples: We don't know the woman who posed for Leonardo so often

definitions.text: sit and travel on the back of animal, usually while controlling its motions
examples: Did you ever ride a camel?
The girl liked to drive the young mare
The White House sits on Pennsylvania Avenue

definitions.text: work or act as a baby-sitter
examples: I cannot baby-sit tonight; I have too much homework to do

definitions.text: show to a seat; assign a seat for
examples: The host seated me next to Mrs. Smith

definitions.text: serve in a specific professional capacity
